alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lafayette County through 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mayo, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mayo and Alton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
